comments: From Pfund spectrum of hydrogen. Wavelengths in hydrogen spectrum are given by Rydberg's formula 1/wavelength = constant*(1/m^2 - 1/n^2).a(n)=(n+5)^2-25=n*(n+10) except a(5p) p pos. Second (with m=5) of this kind after AO61039,Paschen (m=3) and before A061047,Hansen-Strong (m=7). For the fourth,what is the value of m in 1/m^2-1/n^2 ? m=9? [From _Paul Curtz_, Nov 01 2008]
references: J. E. Brady and G. E. Humiston, General Chemistry, 3rd. ed., Wiley; p. 78.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 5..10000
J. J. O'Connor and E. F. Robertson, Johannes Robert Rydberg
Eric Weisstein's World of Physics, Balmer Formula
prog: (Haskell)import Data.Ratio ((%), numerator)a061043 = numerator . (1 % 25 -) . recip . (^ 2) . fromIntegral-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 06 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 26 2001
